positive.review:
because of my niece's great enthusiasm for this game, i always assumed it must be a janky-mascot-horror game for young girls and never gave it the chance it deserved.

Chapter 1 eventually became free and was added to my library where it collected digital dust...until a few days ago.

I finally got around to trying it out and i was shocked by the narrative, polish, world-building, puzzles, and creature-design - all of which were TOP-NOTCH!  I immediately purchased the rest of the bundle (which was half off at the time) and do not regret it.

If you were fooled by your own assumptions about this game then please brush those aside and give this game a chance because its not a janky-mascot game for babies...its a magnificent horror experience that doesn't rely on gore, violence, or cheap-scares to develop its truly haunting atmosphere (don't get me wrong, i love gore, violence, and cheap scares) which provides a challenging (but not tedious) and rewarding experience. 

If you have the funds, don't stop at chapter 1 as the game should be played in its entirety.
it is very fun lots and lots of action but never play alone or if you cant sleep alone

However I do have misgivings on Chapter 4 because it feels rushed and should have been released on a later date like in 2026 or 2027 because the lore has to have some importance and reconsideration of representation and the lore itself that is represented in the game, it kinda feels disconnected as many elements like the nightmare critters and The Doctor Boss Fight feel very bland and Doey's Boss Fight feel very janky and weird. But if you want a game for the scares All the chapters are amazing but if you want to know which games are decent and amazing to play I'd say the first 3 chapters are amazing.

Also this is my judgement. If you want to see and play the game for yourself you may have different opinions. Even so it's your money and decision. Stay Safe and Enjoy the game

So my daughter was obsessed with Poppy Playtime and Huggy Wuggy for a long while and I never really thought much of this game, just another FNAF knockoff, I thought, that I brushed off. Then I saw Markiplier play a section of Chapter 4 and realized this game looked way more impressive than I thought it was. So I got it. Chaper 1 is short, but very nicely done. It's more of a prologue than a full chapter. If you like Chapter 1 even a little, get 2, 3 and 4. Chapter 1 took me 1hr to complete, but after Chapter 4 I have a total of 26 hours of gameplay. They are 10 times longer, well thought out immersive worlds full of horror and puzzles with an actually good story.  This game does a great job with suspense and making you feel creeped out, building tension until something happens that is genuinely scary, and by scary I mean terrifying. I absolutely recommend this whole series. The only downside is that Chapter 4 has some MAJOR bugs. The blue hand glitch is near game-breaking, but you CAN get by it. just drag the saw into where the line is supposed to be and when it bounces up, it will eventually get cut. Other than that, it's worth your money. Just buy it already!

This game is interesting in a good way. The mechanics of the grab pack are great. the sound effects of the hands launching are satisfying and I love how you don't need to move all the way over to something to interact with it. The horror aspect isn't like other games. It doesn't use any jumpscares until the end, instead relying on the atmosphere and emptiness to create an underlaying fear of dread. (I have a fear of abandoned structures and this game touched that a tiny bit.) another good thing is the fact that, if you know what you're doing, you can complete the game in under twenty minutes, making it a good cooldown game for in between larger playthroughs in other titles. I also think that for what it is as a stand alone title, it has a tremendous amount of polish and feels more like an individual chapter than a demo.

To summarize, this game fits in the same category as the Lego Movie. it looks like a cash grab, but it is surprisingly well done and exceeds personal expectations

Poppy Playtime is a horror game where you voluntarily break into an abandoned toy factory to “investigate what happened.”
Spoiler: *exactly what you think happened*.

You:

* Former employee
* No weapons
* Armed with a glorified grabby-hands backpack
* Surrounded by toys that look like they were designed by a committee of sleep paralysis demons

---

### The Setup

You arrive at Playtime Co., which is:

* 90% dark hallways
* 9% suspiciously cheerful posters
* 1% “legally safe VHS tapes explaining totally normal corporate decisions”

And then you meet **Huggy Wuggy**—a 10-foot blue tube sock of pure nightmare fuel who really, *really* values personal space.

---

### Pros

* The **GrabPack** is actually genius:

  * Long-distance button presses
  * Pulling objects
  * Solving puzzles
  * And occasionally slapping a demon toy in the face from across the room

* Toy factory aesthetic is *too* good:

  * Bright colors
  * Big mascot statues
  * Everything screaming “fun for kids!” while the vents scream “this is where people die.”

* Huggy’s chase sequence is the perfect combo of:

  * “Run”
  * “No, faster”
  * “Why are there so many vents”
  * “WHO DESIGNED THIS OSHA NIGHTMARE”

* Short and sweet. You can finish Chapter 1 in a sitting and still spend the rest of the night side-eyeing your childhood stuffed animals.

---

### Cons

* Your character has the survival instincts of a horror protagonist:

  * Sees 7-foot toy statue
  * Blinks
  * Statue is gone
  * “Yeah, I’ll keep exploring.”

* The GrabPack wires are both your best friend and your worst enemy; half the puzzles are “wrap this around that,” the other half are “why did I tie a knot with electricity.”

* If vent claustrophobia and “loud stompy things behind you” aren’t your jam, congratulations: this is your villain origin story.

* After playing, any merch of Huggy Wuggy stops being “haha funny toy” and becomes “I know what you’ve done.”

---

### Peak Poppy Moments

* Watching Huggy slowly lean out from a dark space and realizing the game went from “spooky tour” to “active cardio session.”

* Solving a puzzle and being proud for exactly 0.3 seconds before the lights go out and the soundtrack asks if your affairs are in order.

* Getting lost in the vent maze, turning the wrong way, and running **directly into** the thing you’re supposed to be escaping.

* Finishing the chapter, triggering that final scene, and audibly saying “NOPE” to your monitor like that will help.

---

### Final Verdict

It’s short, it’s loud, it’s colorful, and it weaponizes children’s toys more effectively than your childhood nightmares ever did.

**9/10**
Would once again break into a haunted toy factory for zero pay, trust a pair of sentient grab-hands to keep me safe, and find out the hard way that Huggy does *not* do cuddles.

Eu joguei todos os capítulos e posso dizer, com todo certeza, o jogo é simplesmente incrível! Todos os capítulos tem seus altos e baixos, e por mais que regem bugs (principalmente no lançamento) a história, mecânica, cenário e personagens te absorvem do início ao fim (para mim, capítulo 3 é o melhor entre todos).

For those who were like me and refused to play this game due to the initial controversy, it’s all been addressed, and they’ve apologized.

This game is not a ripoff of anything. (I’ve watched gameplay of Venge, and it’s different enough where I can say that it's not an intentional ripoff, it’s really an unfortunate coincidence.)

Due to the backlash, Mob stopped selling those NFTs and donated all the money they made off of them to charity.

Nobody was bullied to suicide. From what I’ve read, it wasn’t even a bar brawl, but a playground squabble in terms of scale, and they’ve stopped with the one guy it was really with.

Let it go and enjoy this game, this game is excellent! I love the Grab Pack, both just shooting it for fun, and the puzzles with them. The puzzles can actually be challenging, and the popgun sounds the Grab Pack makes when you shoot its hands are sublime. I could spend an hour just shooting them for fun!

For Chapter 4, don’t let the negative talk about it deter you from it. It has an excellent story, I just don’t understand how it’s bad like some say. It positively contributes to the story, Dr. Harley Sawyer is probably my favorite villain in the game so far, and his reveal was awesome! Doey is one of my favorite characters in the game because he’s so lovable. There was some tedium in the part where you have to get the power running while avoiding Yarnaby, but it’s not as bad when you figure out what to do.

For the glitches, they’ve patched many of them. Some I’ve encountered are the battery Doey gives you getting stuck in the ceiling, Yarnaby shaking, and the LOD on the ground in this part you zipline across looking bad. (I’m unsure if that’s a glitch or oversight) I’ve done 2 playthroughs and encountered no major game breaking glitches.

Despite this, I still think Chapter 4 is good, and I recommend it. I’m happy they’ve patched so many of the glitches it launched with within 2 months.

My point is Poppy Playtime is excellent, this is a former hater saying this, so you know it's good. I missed out on something amazing because I was hung up on the initial controversy.
I recommend to play this game while blasting your favorite musical theatre songs (mine was wicked)

negative.review:
Second review of the day.
I got past the first glitch/bug by looking it up, I wasn't the only one who stumbled upon the blue hand bug.
After that the game went on, but I lost enjoyment because of the bug.
Now I'm at the fight with Doey, it is impossible to play. The moment I use one of my hands, I jump really high and can't get back down. I tried restarting the game, load an older save file. Nothing seems to work.
After some searching on the internet, I noticed I'm far from the only one with this problem.

I find it just embarrassing that this game that has been out for almost a year still has these major issues.
Especially considering that there were A LOT of complaints about the game being to buggy on release.
That Mob released it to soon. Guess you didn't really solve the problem.

Makes me worry for chapter 5. I really like this franchise and the lore, but if chapter 5 is as unplayable als chapter 4. Count me out, I'll watch a let's play on youtube.

Such a shame

Chapters 1-3 are phenomenal. Great environmental storytelling, they run well even on a nintendo switch or cheap gaming laptop, and it's one of the best mascot horror games I've seen

HAVING SAID THAT. Chapter 4 is a mess. Bugged to hell and back even though it's been years since release: issues with grabpack hands not working properly, batteries just *not spawning* in the Baba Chops puzzle rendering it impossible, Yarnaby clipping through walls, etc. We spent 30 minutes soft-locked due to the Items Not Spawning issue. Finally decided to look up a guide, and lo and behold, our necessary item was not there. Quit the game, reloaded, and it still wasn't there. We can't continue our playthrough, so I honestly can't recommend anyone spend money on chapter 4. Here's hoping #5 performs better because, yeesh. This has really dampened by enjoyment of PPT :/

This game seemed fun and when I saw videos on it I wished I had it, not knowing the first part was free. The game ran fine until after I got the second hand where my game felt wrong, the part after you get the hand you need to open a door but it took me around 20 minutes to get the damn thing open. Than after that painful experience I finally got it opned and the next thing you have to do is go through a vent, but my damn thing wasn't respanding to my keys being pressed. I unistalled and reinstalled trying to fix it but nothing worked, I checked the controls and everything was fine so I finally gave up and unistalled for good. This game was extreamly hard for me to play and its not like I have a bad PC either.

3/10

Initially I was very into this game, the game-play was fun and unique, the graphics were on point, the tension was very solid, music was really rad, and I was happy to have bought it. 

That's the part that stings to me, I bought it, at the time the team that makes it said that they would be releasing subsequent chapters at a fixed price if not free. I really enjoyed the game was was excited for the future chapters, but as soon as Chapter 2 came out they made C1 free and C2 was double the price. 

They will always value their profits over your satisfaction as a customer and player.

Don't trust them.

FOUND A FIX FOR ANY GLITCH YOU RUN INTO BY ACCIDENT FOR CHAPTER 4
go into your savegames folder and just delete recent saved game file

so go to this directory
%localappdata%/ch4_pro/Saved/SaveGames 
then delete recent saved game file it will look like this
SaveGame_2025.09.10-08.34.20.sav    9/10/2025  4:35 PM 
delete just 1 or 2 depending how far back you want to go. Better then starting at the beginning. Hope this Helps

TWO game braking glitches in both chapter 3 and 4 that you need to get a save file for both of them just to be able to play the game without starting from the very start. without the save file there is NO guaranteing the glitch wont happen again in the same spot. The Dog day broke because I died after the final jump and it didn't reset my checkpoint it made me move forward I go up the elevator walk out the level to a pitch black world with no way to continue. And the doctor freeze room didn't reset the hand on the table so now I'M STUCK AGAIN! the fact I have to download outside files from speedrun.com website just to reset a check point is crazy. FIX YOUR GAME PLEASE! don't buy if your not tech savvy enough to reset save files from AppData folder. before you play have the files ready to swap so you don't get yanked out of your game having to research all this nonsense just to play a game you payed for

My graphics card got corrupted by this game

Second review of the day.
I got past the first glitch/bug by looking it up, I wasn't the only one who stumbled upon the blue hand bug.
After that the game went on, but I lost enjoyment because of the bug.
Now I'm at the fight with Doey, it is impossible to play. The moment I use one of my hands, I jump really high and can't get back down. I tried restarting the game, load an older save file. Nothing seems to work.
After some searching on the internet, I noticed I'm far from the only one with this problem.

I find it just embarrassing that this game that has been out for almost a year still has these major issues.
Especially considering that there were A LOT of complaints about the game being to buggy on release.
That Mob released it to soon. Guess you didn't really solve the problem.

Makes me worry for chapter 5. I really like this franchise and the lore, but if chapter 5 is as unplayable als chapter 4. Count me out, I'll watch a let's play on youtube.

Such a shame
the game has so many bugs ı cant play yarnaby ıs teleportıng sometımes and devıces or machıne are not workıng pls dont purchase

Chapters 1-3 are phenomenal. Great environmental storytelling, they run well even on a nintendo switch or cheap gaming laptop, and it's one of the best mascot horror games I've seen

HAVING SAID THAT. Chapter 4 is a mess. Bugged to hell and back even though it's been years since release: issues with grabpack hands not working properly, batteries just *not spawning* in the Baba Chops puzzle rendering it impossible, Yarnaby clipping through walls, etc. We spent 30 minutes soft-locked due to the Items Not Spawning issue. Finally decided to look up a guide, and lo and behold, our necessary item was not there. Quit the game, reloaded, and it still wasn't there. We can't continue our playthrough, so I honestly can't recommend anyone spend money on chapter 4. Here's hoping #5 performs better because, yeesh. This has really dampened by enjoyment of PPT :/

This is quite literally a bendy and the ink machine clone and is actively making some of the same mistakes as the makers of that game were doing. Also it's an incredibly buggy game and I don't find the lore to be interesting enough. I find the puzzles to be very frustrating too it's also just not my style of game. Like there's a few really tense moments in this game, but I don't think it evens out the frustrations I have while playing this.
